qas.question: What corporation bought The Times in 1981?
Who owned the major corporation that bought The Times in 1981?
During the acquisition of The Times in 1981, John Collier and Bill O'Neill were part of what group that did three weeks of intensive bargaining?

context: In 1981, The Times and The Sunday Times were bought from Thomson by <a1_0>Rupert Murdoch<a1_0/>'s <a0_0>News International<a0_0/>. The acquisition followed three weeks of intensive bargaining with <a2_0>the unions<a2_0/> by company negotiators, John Collier and Bill O'Neill.
